Blue-emitting LEDs were fabricated with the device structure proposed by Gangishetty et al., where a TFB (poly[(9,9-dioctylfluorenyl-2,7-diyl)-co-(4,4′-(N-(4- s-butylphenyl) diphenylamine)]) layer covered with Nafion perfluorinated ionomer (PFI) is used as an HTL for improved hole injection.

Figure S5 shows device performance of our LEDs based on DDAX-stabilized CsPb(Br 1– x Cl
x ) 3 NCs with EL peak at 480 nm. While EQE of ∼0.57% is a modest improvement in comparison to ref ( 60) (0.44% at 481 nm, OLA/OA-synthesized NCs), the brightness was approximately 10-fold higher and reached 2500 Cd/m 2 (vs 212 Cd/m 2 in ref ( 60)). We should also note that we were not able to fully suppress the EL from the TFB layer (at ∼430 nm) by the application of PFI, presumably because of the suboptimal thickness of the perovskite NC layer and hence electron injection into TFB.
